page.title: 04LADY PARK WOOD
page.content: {Lady Park Wood}borders{the River {Wye}near{The Biblins}(5514) and became a{National Nature Reserve}in the spring of{1984.}It is now controlled by the{Nature Conservancy Council} under a 99 year lease from the{ {Forestry Commission.} The wood was last coppiced in 1906 and since{1944}the{106 acres}have been completely neglected. At the same time a similar area of woodland nearby is being tended in the normal way. {Six}surveys have been carried out in the last{40 years}the most recent being in{1984.}Results so far have revealed a smaller range and number of wildlife species than in the tended woodland nearby. It may be as many as {200 years}before the resulst of the experiment is really known!
